page.title: 09Use of the land
page.content: Farming is the staple use of land in this area with ceral crops being the prime acreage with grazing land a close second.As there is little or no milk production all stock is for meat production and this includes,in addition to cattle and sheep,pigs which are reared at Flawborough and Thoroton.One whole concern at Flawborough is geared to large production of pigs for the meat market At Thoroton is a large concern with egg production for the grocery market. Along with these is the production of wool from the sheep at Alverton.The cereal crops are wheat,barley and oats and rape,sugar beet,peas and beans to a lesser degree.Due to overproduction of cereals farmers are beginning to turn to crops such as veg.,lupins and flax.
